open_spaces_details.open_space_type: Outdoor sports facilities incl. school playing fields

description:
Full planning permission for the removal of the existing temporary portacabin buildings, demolition of the existing bungalow and laundry building, retention and reconfiguration of the existing pavilion building
and redevelopment comprising the construction of a part two storey, part single storey training facility for Brentford Football Club, including the Club's offices. In addition, the development proposes a single storey maintenance building and standalone water tank, a single storey site  management/security building, new service road, an artificial 4G training track and 4G playing pitch, car parking for up to 106 vehicles, plus overspill for a further 38 parking spaces, 54 cycle parking spaces, and hard and soft landscaping.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the 31st January 2021.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (Travel Plan; Transport Statement; Planning Statement; Air Quality Assessment; Preliminary Ecological Appraisal; Sustainability Statement; Alternative Site Assessment Report; Design and Access Statement; NSC09; Stack-2817; PRT_97m39mCHN01E Sht 1 of 2; POHBFC5; POHBFC6; POHBFC7; POHBFC8; POHBFC9; POHBFC10; POHBFC11; POHBFC12; POHBFC13; POHBFC14; POHBFC15; POHBFC16-A; POHBFC17; POHBFC18; POHBFC19; POHBFC1; POHBFC2; POHBFC3; POHBFC4; POHBFC5 Elevations; POHBFC6 Elevations; POHBFC7 Elevations; POHBFC8 Elevations; POHBFC9 Elevations; POHBFC10 Elevations; POHBFC11 Elevations; POHBFC12 Elevations; POHBFC13 Elevations; POHBFC14 Elevations; POHBFC16 Elevations; POHBFC17 Elevations; POHBFC18 Elevations; POHBFC19 Elevations; POHBFC20 Elevations; 0693-001-P1 (Location Plan); 0693-125-P2 (Site Management); 0693-005-P2 (Existing Site Plan); 0693-007-P2 (Existing Block Plan); 0693-010-P1 (Existing Bungalow & Pavilion Plans); 0693-020-P1 (Existing Bungalow & Pavilion Elevations); Received 03/01/2019; Greenfield runoff estimation for sites; Received 29/05/2019; Flood Risk Assessment & Drainage Strategy Report; Overland Flow Path Analysis (2066 Rev P1); Received 05/07/2019; Transport Technical Note; Received 13/06/2019; 0693-075-A-P8 Proposed Block Plan; 0693-100-A-P8 (Proposed Ground Floor Plan); 0693-101-A-P8 (Proposed First Floor Plan); 0693-200-A-P8 (Proposed North & East Elevations); 0693-201-A-P8 (Proposed South & West Elevations); 0693-250-A-P8 (Proposed Cross Section); Received 16/09/2019; 0693-050-A-P4 (Proposed Site Plan); Received 08/10/2019;; Energy Statement Rev P4 (September 2019); Received 25/09/2019; Proposed Phasing Plans (0693-180-P8; 0693-181-P8; 0693-182-P8; 0693-183-P8; 0693-184-P8; 0693-185-P8); Received 07/05/2020) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writ

Condition : 3 - No development shall take place on any phase above ground slab until  samples of the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of that phase are submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Each phase of the development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved details.
Condition : 4 - The offices hereby permitted shall be used only by Brentford Football Club and shall not become a separate use (B1 - offices) at any time.

Condition : 5 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am  to 6:00pm on Mondays to Friday and 9 :00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 6 - Prior to the commencement of Phase 2 of the development hereby permitted, a scheme in accordance with the requirements of BS 5837 (2012) 'Trees in Relation to Design, Demolition and Construction' for all the existing trees identified within the Proposed Block Plan (0693-075-A-P8) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The protection measures as approved shall be undertaken at the site before any work in connection with Phase 2 of the development hereby permitted commences at the site, and shall be retained for the entire period of the duration of any work at the site. Within the fence or other means of enclosure surrounding the trees, no activities associated with the approved building operations shall take place unless previously agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 7 - There shall be no floodlights installed within the site without permission from the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 8 - No development shall take place, including any works of demolition, other than the re-location of the existing temporary buildings, until a Construction Logistics Plan that conforms to current TfL guidance has been submitted to, and approved in writing by, the local planning authority. The approved Plan shall be adhered to throughout the construction period. The Plan shall include: 
i. a site plan (showing the areas set out below) 
ii. confirmation that a pre-start record of site conditions on the adjoining public highway will be undertaken with Hounslow Highways and a commitment to repair any damage caused by construction activity 
iii. provision for the parking of vehicles of site operatives and visitors 
iv. provisions for loading, unloading and storage of plant and materials within the site 
v. details of access to the site, including means to control and manage access and egress of vehicles to and from the site for the duration of construction including phasing arrangements 
vi. details of vehicle routeing from the site to the wider strategic road network 
vii. the erection and maintenance of security hoarding including decorative displays and facilities for public viewing, where appropriate 
viii. provision of wheel washing facilities at the site exit and a commitment to sweep adjacent roads when required and at the request of the council 
ix. a scheme for recycling/disposing of waste resulting from demolition and construction works 
x. measures to ensure the safety of all users of the public highway especially cyclists and pedestrians in the vicinity of the site and especially at the access 
xi. commitment to liaise with other contractors in the vicinity of the site to maximise the potential for consolidation and to minimise traffic impacts. 
xii. avoidance of peak hours for deliveries and details of a booking system to avoid vehicles waiting on the public highway 
xiii. all necessary traffic orders and other permissions required to allow safe ac

Condition : 9 - Prior to the occupation of a new building in any phase hereby approved, full details of soft landscape works for that phase shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and these works shall be carried out as approved.  These details shall include: planting plans; written specifications (including cultivation and other operations associated with plant and grass establishment); schedules of plants, noting species, plant sizes and proposed numbers/densities where appropriate; implementation programme and maintenance schedule. Any such planting which within a period of five years of implementation of the landscaping dies, is removed, or becomes seriously damaged or diseased shall be replaced in the next planting season with others of a similar size or species. The approved scheme shall be fully implemented prior to the first use of the building in that phase and the maintenance schedule adhered to thereafter.

Condition : 10 - Prior to the first use of a new building in any phase hereby approved, a Parking Management Plan for that phase shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority that sets out how the site will be managed. The Plan will need to include a commitment to provide the Local Planning Authority with an annual list of events for which the overspill parking area will be made available agreeable to the Local Planning Authority, measures and barriers to ensure that it is not available for use outside of these events, regular monitoring of parking demand with a view to permanently reducing the number of spaces if practicable, details of EV charging points and when the passive provision will be brought into use, and measures to ensure that vehicles accessing and egressing do prejudice highway safety or traffic flow on Jersey Road. The buildings shall thereafter operate in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 11 - Prior to the occupation of a new building in any phase hereby approved, the details of cycle parking facilities for that phase shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of that phase and permanently retained thereafter.

Condition : 12 - The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the phasing plan hereby approved. The 4G pitch, hydrotherapy pool and overspill car park hereby approved shall only be constructed, if the Club are promoted to the Premier League.

Condition : 13 - Prior to the occupation of a new building in any phase, a Delivery and Servicing Plan for that phase shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall accord with current guidance such as that issued by Transport for London and shall show that peak times are avoided for deliveries and servicing and that articulated vehicles are not used. The Plan shall be carried out as approved. The approved measures for each phase shall be implemented before first occupation of a building in that phase and shall be so maintained for the life of the development.

Condition : 14 - The waste and recycled materials storage arrangements shown on the approved drawings shall be completed before any part of the accommodation hereby permitted is occupied and permanently retained thereafter.

Condition : 15 - No development shall take place on any phase above ground slab until a finalised Energy Strategy, including details for each phase of development, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 16 - a)	No development shall take place on any phase above ground slab until a BREEAM New Construction 2018 Fully-fitted preliminary-assessment estimator for that phase is  submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority demonstrating how an 'Excellent' (minimum score 70%) rating will be achieved.
b)	Within three months of work starting on the final phase above ground slab, a BREEAM New Construction 2018 Fully-fitted Design Stage certificate and summary score sheet for that phase must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to show that an 'Excellent' (minimum score 70%) rating will be achieved.
c)	Within six months of first occupation of the building(s) in the final phase above ground slab, a BREEAM New Construction 2018 Fully-fitted Post-Construction Review certificate and summary score sheet for that phase must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to show that an 'Excellent' (minimum score 70%) rating has been achieved.

Condition : 17 - The solar photovoltaic panels must be installed on the roof of the building hereby permitted in accordance with drawing no. 0693 102 P9 (Proposed Roof Plan) and maintained as such thereafter.
Condition : 18 - The development hereby permitted shall follow the mitigation measures and recommendations in the Preliminary Ecological Appraisal (PEA), received on 3 January 2019.

Condition : 19 - Prior to commencement of groundworks (excluding site investigations, demolition and re-location of existing temporary buildings) for the new building, a final detailed drainage design including drawings and supporting calculations and updated Drainage Assessment Form shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and the Lead Local Flood Authority. The drainage strategy shall utilise infiltration so that there is no surface water runoff off-site. If this is not possible, then a maximum discharge rate from the developable area (including the 4G pitch) must be no more than 3.5 litres/second (for events up to and including the 1 in 100 year rainfall with a 40% climate change consideration). A detailed management plan confirming routine maintenance tasks for all drainage components must also be submitted to demonstrate how the drainage system is to be maintained for the lifetime of the development and the management plan shall be put into effect before first occupation.

Condition : 20 - Prior to the first occupation of a building in any phase hereby approved, evidence (photographs and installation contracts) to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme for that phase has been completed in accordance with the submitted details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components.

Condition : 21 - Prior to first occupation of a building in the final phase of development hereby approved, evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the National Calculation Method) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the building(s) in that phase has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy.

Upon final commencement of operation of any low and zero carbon technologies, suitable devices for the monitoring of the low and zero carbon technologies shall have been installed, and the monitored data shall be submitted automatically to a monitoring web-platform at daily intervals for a period of five years from the point of full operation.

Condition : 22 - All developments are required to meet the following sustainable materials standards and each phase of the development hereby approved shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of delivery notes, invoices or installation contracts) has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development in that phase meets the following:
a) At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.
b) No construction or insulation materials are to be used which will release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.
c) At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.

Condition : 23 - Prior to first occupation of the building(s) in a phase, evidence (schedule of fittings and manufactures literature) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development in that phase has targeted an internal water use of 105L/person/day or less.

Condition : 24 - Notwithstanding the approved drawings full details of all works to the public highway, are to be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council with all work completed and made available for use prior to first occupation of the development hereby permitted.
